intro: Cordylanthus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Cordylanthus parviflorus is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water.
